title: Bans should be used to take out champions that counter your planned team comp.
body:
Not to ban OP champs because Riot fucked up.

If the game was in a good balance state, that could be possible. If you were to plan to pick a "Protect the Kog" comp, you should ban anti-kog champions. And the enemy, by analyzing those bans, should be able to ban Kog'Maw not because he's OP and rocking a 55% win rate but to mess your plan. But you can't anymore, because you'll leave Yi or Udyr open and unless they are really bad with that champ you've pretty much lost.

Because as the game is, the same 5 champions get banned with that one 6th ban that happens because the guy doesn't know what he's doing (Pls stop banning Illaoi).

Rito pls fix

source: played Quinn before she was cool
Quinn? Really?

In the eyes of anyone who can use her vault, she is THE definiton of an anti-melee marksman.

The only thing she is missing is hard cc, which her e techinically provides but not enough to be beneficial.

However, the only way a melee should catch up to Quinn is if either:
1: if they are {{champion:77}} 
2: If they waste flash

If you are trying to fight her 1v1, odds are you are going to lose, because Quinn is designed to be able to 1v1 extremely well.

Do you complain that your team got trashed because you tried to fight Illaoi in a narrow corridor? No.

So don't complain when you play into Quinn's strengths. Instead, fight around them. Build armor early, play safer (as she's low range), and ask for ganks when possible. As long as she isn't fed, if you can get two people on top of her and CC her, she isn't going to get out of that alive unless she burns flash.
This, so many people don't realize just how squishy Quinn is if you get in her face.
